metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8858 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The uglify-js package before 2.6.0 for Node.js allows attackers to cause adenial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input in a parse call, akaa "regular expression denial of service (ReDoS)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8858` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-uglify - 2.8.29-3
node-uglify - 2.8.29-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: uglifyjs package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.29-3').
